title: How To Train Your Dog Not To Bark Excessively
summary: There are many reasons why dogs bark, but one thing is certain – excessive barking can be annoying and stressful for both dogs and their owners. Fortunately, there are ways to train your dog not to bark so frequently and effectively. Read on to discover how you can curb your dog’s excessive barking quickly and easily! Excessive Barking Due To Boredom can often be a sign that your dog needs more exercise and mental stimulation. An understimulated dog is more likely to become bored and anxious, which in turn can lead to excessive barking.

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Dogs bark for a variety of reasons and in different situations. Some dogs seem to bark much more than others, leading some owners to wonder how to train your dog not to bark excessively. When your dog barks excessively or at the wrong times, it can be annoying for you and other members of your household. You might find it difficult to get restful sleep when your dog won\u2019t stop barking or cries whenever you leave the house.
There are many reasons why dogs bark, but one thing is certain \u2013 excessive barking can be annoying and stressful for both dogs and their owners. Fortunately, there are ways to train your dog not to bark so frequently and effectively. Read on to discover how you can curb your dog\u2019s excessive barking quickly and easily!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

An understimulated dog is more likely to become bored and anxious, which in turn can lead to excessive barking. 5 Tips for Eating Healthy on a Budget

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you trying to eat healthier but find that healthy foods are expensive? Are you trying to make a good meal last for several days and not just one? Are you struggling to find affordable, healthy options near your home or work? If so, you\u2019re not alone. Eating healthy can be expensive and challenging. The cost of healthy food has gone up while the cost of unhealthy food has gone down. But this doesn\u2019t mean that eating healthy is impossible; it just means we all need to get a little bit more creative.
Eating well on a budget can be challenging, but it isn\u2019t impossible. Making smart choices about what you buy as well as how you cook your food can make a big difference in how much money you spend on food each month and how healthy your diet is at the same time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Make Your Mornings Easier

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`You know those people who seem to get out of bed with ease every morning? You know, the people that you see on Instagram and wonder how they\u2019re so happy so early in the day? Well, we hate to break it to you but those people have their own set of problems. Getting up after a long night is hard for them too; the only difference is that their solutions work.
These people have their own rituals and habits when it comes to waking up in the morning. If these folks can do it then why can\u2019t we? It\u2019s because some of us are too comfortable, which means we need to shake things up! Do you want to be one of those people who gets out of bed with ease and has a productive day ahead of them? In this blog post, we\u2019ll tell you 5 ways you can make your mornings easier.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always Travelling
How to Deal with Envy in Relationships

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Being in a new relationship is exciting and often feels like a whirlwind. You spend time getting to know each other and spending time together as much as possible. But things can change once you enter a committed relationship or get married. Stressors from work, family, friends and other responsibilities may arise, putting stress on your relationship. This is when green-eyed monster envy creeps in and can have a negative impact on your partner.
There are many different types of relationships: friendships, casual dating or serious partners. Regardless of what type of relationships you have with another person, envy probably won\u2019t be far behind if they are important to you. Envy is one of the seven deadly sins for good reason. When we experience envy in a relationship it creates distrust, resentment and can ultimately end things prematurely before they even really begin. However, there are ways to deal with this feeling so that it doesn\u2019t get the better of you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always Working

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Working too much is a problem many people struggle with \u2014 but it\u2019s even more challenging when you\u2019re in a relationship with someone who has the same work ethic. If your partner usually leaves for work before you even get out of bed, or isn\u2019t home until after you\u2019re already in bed, things can get tricky.
Working from home, flexible hours and remote working are all buzzwords in today\u2019s labor market. Companies are becoming increasingly aware that it isn\u2019t just about how much time employees spend at the desk but also about what they achieve during that time. A Gallup poll found that telecommuting or working from home is growing in popularity among professionals across most industries. Working remotely makes it easier to find jobs, negotiate schedules and live without a commute.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Wait
How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always on Their Computer

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you enter into a relationship with another person, you\u2019ll naturally want to spend as much time together as possible. It can be super easy to fall into a routine when you\u2019re spending so much time with each other. You go to work, come home, and then retreat to your respective rooms for the rest of the night. And while that routine is totally normal and understandable at this stage in your relationship, it might not be exactly what you\u2019re looking for.
It\u2019s easy to get jealous or resentful if your partner is always on their computer \u2014 but that doesn\u2019t mean that there isn\u2019t a reason for their constant use of it. It could be that they are really passionate about something they\u2019re researching online or maybe they have an online business venture they\u2019ve been working on for a while now. However, if this is causing tension between you two, speak up! They may not even realize how much time they spend on their computer and just how much of an impact it has on your relationship. Here are some ways to deal with a partner who's always on their computer:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
